text:
- Hi, I'm Urmila Kukreja,
Director of Product at Smartsheet.
I lead our AI initiatives.

- And JB Brown, VP of
Engineering at Smartsheet.
- I'm gonna ask you first.
- Okay.
- Sorry, this question made me laugh,
because we talked about this.
If you could have an AI assistant

for any one task in your
life, what would it be?
- So I hate- I get so frustrated

trying to match up the
Tupperware lid to the Tupperware

that I end up giving up and
letting my wife figure it out,

and so I would love for
a solution for that,
or something that just magically made

the right Tupperware
container and lid on the spot.
- I think it's a really good one.

I also think it's a while before
AI is solving that for you.

Mine was going to be laundry,
but I also think it's a while

before AI is figuring that.
- Folding?

All of it?
- All of it.

I think there's an
agent to do the laundry,

another one to start drying
it, fold it, put it away,
all of it is taken care of, yes.

- All right, most
creative thing you've done
with generative AI to date?
- The most creative thing?
Type of funny thing maybe that happened

when I tried to do my
daughter's birthday cards.

She's 10 and she's a Swifty,
and I think we were like,

"Oh, we're gonna make these
sleepover birthday cards,"
and she also loves dogs,

so I feel like we really
messed up the prompt there

when we said, "Hey, just
come up with something
with Taylor Swift and dogs."
You can imagine we messed up
on our prompt engineering there,
which was a good lesson for both of us.
But it was a fun, creative exercise.

- I would say the thing
that happens in our house

that's most creative is the
made-up bedtime stories,
the AI agent made-up bedtime stories

where my 9-year-old and my
13-year-old fill in the blanks,

and then my wife somehow
tells these crazy,
nonsensical stories without laughing.
I don't know how she does it,
but she just reads right through it.
It's crazy.

What unexpected benefits
or use cases have emerged
since implementing Amazon Q,

and how are you capitalizing
on these discoveries?

what's been unexpected
is not just the time savings,
but also how our global workforce
has been able to take advantage of this.
We're primarily focused on Pacific time,
but we do have a presence in Australia
and other parts of the world,

and I think one of the
power users of Q actually

is a CSM in Australia,
who as she was onboarding,

she felt like she had
this personal assistant

helping her answer all kinds
of questions about Smartsheet

that helped her serve
her customers better.

The other one that I don't
think we've fully capitalized on

but has been about, you
actually pointed it out to us,
where you can ask a question in a language
and you get a response in that language.
So, Smartsheet is internationalized
and it's available in over 50 languages,

but that's the experience
in the interface.
The content you put in it
is in the language you put the content in.
The expectation generally
is if your sheet's written in German,
it's meant for a German audience,

and it doesn't translate
the content for you.
One of the things we noticed
is if that sheet that was in German,

if I happen to ask a
question of it say in Hindi,
which is a language I understand,

the response would come back
to me in Hindi or English,
which is another language I understand.
- I agree with you.
It was fascinating to see that in the data
the first time I realized, oh,
someone's getting answers in French

even though all of the content
that we put in is in English,
and it was just a light bulb moment
for international expansion
that we had this unexpected value
that we were more ready than we thought.

You mentioned the person
that was onboarding.
That new employee within two weeks
was one of the highest users of Q Business

because she was typing
in pretend scenarios

that she thought a
customer would ask of her,

or maybe it was something
similar to what was asked of her,

like a whole scenario of
how do I use Smartsheet for,

I don't know, like real estate
industry for this use case,
and it would give her all of the features
and how you would stitch it together.

She's doing self-guided
onboarding to our company.
It was awesome.
- Can you discuss any custom development
or modifications made to Amazon Q
to better suit Smartsheet's needs?

- Yeah, this one's pretty easy,
because the answer is none.
We pretty much used it out of the box.
The custom development we had to do
was outside of Q Business, actually.

It's really easy to go through
the AWS console and set it up.

The first thing that we
added was a web crawler,

so you pick content that
you want to put into

your Q Business app, and
we just picked web crawler

and we pointed at our
public help documentation

that our customers would use
to understand Smartsheet.
Now you've got a Q Business app, right?
That's it, it's really easy.

The thing that we did have
to do was work with our IDP

and understand how our
identity provider that we use

for corporate authentication
would properly integrate
with Q Business.

Not the Q Business side,
but we had to stand that up
to make sure that that app was secure

with our corporate authentication
and authorization systems,

which is one of the huge
values of Q Business,

because it's your internal
knowledge, which is private,

and you want to keep
it private and secure.

It's in your AWS account, and
so the data at rest is secure,
but you also want access to be secure.
So we had to do that part.
It wasn't that big of a deal,
but was something we had to work at.
Urmila, that was an awesome conversation.
Thank you for telling everybody about
Smartsheet's use of Amazon Q.
Where are we going from here?
What does the partnership look like?

- We have a wonderful
partnership with Amazon.
They're a customer of ours.
We're a customer of theirs.
A lot of our workloads run on AWS.
We GA'd the Smartsheet Connector
for Amazon Q at the conference.
We've seen good adoption of it so far.

What I'm really excited about
is bringing that experience
within the Smartsheet experience next

so people can stay within
the Smartsheet experience,

get answers, unlock insights
from all of their data
in Smartsheet while also getting data
that may not necessarily be in Smartsheet

and not having to know where
it sits organizationally,

so bringing all that power
within your Smartsheet experience
is what I'm excited about.
- Me, too.
I can't wait.
